qas.question: What classic area of study is now mostly reserved for academic consideration?
Most serious studies in philosophy are segregated to what publications?
Who are some of the most important philosophers in history?

answers.text: Plato, Aristotle, Socrates, Augustine, Descartes, Kierkegaard, Nietzsche

qas.question: What aspect of modern academic philosophy is less literary than technical in nature?
Serious studies in logic tend to resemble what discipline, moreso than literature?
Most new pychologic work appears where?
Besides Plato, Achilles, Socrates, and Augustine, who are other noted major philosophers in history?
What is considered more literary and less technical?

plausible_answers.text: Plato, Aristotle, Socrates, Augustine, Descartes, Kierkegaard, Nietzsche

qas.question: Who are the major practitioners through history?
What have recent literature works argued to the merit the title of?
Logic is technical and similar to what field of study?

context: <a0_0>Philosophy<a0_0/> has become <b5_0>an increasingly academic discipline<b5_0/>. More of its practitioners lament this situation than occurs with the sciences; nonetheless most new philosophical work appears <b6_0>in <a1_0>academic journals<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Major philosophers through history—<a2_0><b9_0>Plato, Aristotle, Socrates, Augustine, <b7_0>Descartes, Kierkegaard, Nietzsche<b9_0/><b7_0/><a2_0/>—have become as canonical as any writers. Some recent <b10_0>philosophy<b10_0/> works are argued to merit the title "literature", but much of it does not, and some areas, such as <a3_0><b8_0>logic<b8_0/><a3_0/>, have become extremely technical to a degree similar to that of <a4_0><b11_0>mathematics<b11_0/><a4_0/>.
